intro: Lepidosperma costale var. densispicatum, commonly known as the dense-spined sedgeland sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its dense, spiky appearance helps it compete effectively in its wetland environment.
